titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ossian Huggins Letters, 1868-1876
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Personal letters of Ossian Huggins while he was a student at Washington College, Lexington, Virginia, commenting on courses offered, requirements for obtaining degrees, and Robert E. Lee as president of the College. Included are two letters from a later period.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Ossian Huggins letters, 1868-1876, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Ossian Huggins was a resident of Summerville (Chattooga County), Georgia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Personal letters of Ossian Huggins while he was a student at Washington College, Lexington, Virginia, commenting on courses offered, requirements for obtaining degrees, and Robert E. Lee as president of the College. Included are two letters from a later period.
